1:

2:

>>> go workshop <<<
3:
I am in the workshop. My task is to determine if unknown substance B is electrically conductive. The first step is to focus on the unknown substance B. I see an object called "unknown substance" in the available objects, which I assume is unknown substance B.

>>> focus on unknown substance <<<
4:
I have focused on unknown substance B. Now I need to determine if it is electrically conductive. I see a battery, wires, and light bulbs, which suggests I can build a circuit to test its conductivity.

I will connect the battery to a light bulb, and then insert the unknown substance B into the circuit to see if the light bulb lights up.

First, I will connect the anode of the battery to one terminal of a wire. I will use the black wire.

>>> connect anode in battery to black wire terminal 1 <<<
5:
Now I will connect the other end of the black wire (terminal 2) to the anode of the green light bulb.

>>> connect black wire terminal 2 to anode in green light bulb <<<
6:
I have connected the battery to the green light bulb. Now I need to insert the unknown substance B into the circuit. I will connect the cathode of the green light bulb to one end of another wire, and the other end of that wire to the unknown substance B. Then I will connect the other side of the unknown substance B to the cathode of the battery.

I will use the blue wire.

>>> connect cathode in green light bulb to blue wire terminal 1 <<<
7:
I have connected the cathode of the green light bulb to terminal 1 of the blue wire. Now I will connect terminal 2 of the blue wire to the unknown substance.

>>> connect blue wire terminal 2 to unknown substance <<<
8:
I have connected the blue wire to the unknown substance B. Now I need to complete the circuit by connecting the other side of the unknown substance B to the cathode of the battery. I will use the orange wire for this.

>>> connect unknown substance B to orange wire terminal 1 <<<
9:
I have connected terminal 2 on unknown substance B to terminal 1 on the orange wire. Now I will connect terminal 2 of the orange wire to the cathode of the battery to complete the circuit.

>>> connect orange wire terminal 2 to battery cathode <<<
10:
I have completed the circuit. If the unknown substance B is conductive, the green light bulb should light up. I need to observe the green light bulb.

The light bulb is not lit. This indicates that the unknown substance B is not electrically conductive.

My task is to place it in the green box if it is electrically nonconductive.

>>> move unknown substance to green box <<<
